item.title: Trees need reducing and dead branches removed., 28th August
item.description:
Trees used to be maintained, however haven’t been cut back for a few years. Large branches are falling in garden and are a H & S risk. One tree fell down 2022 into back garden. If one fell down now it would hit the houses as they are so tall and really to near the house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wrotham Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole & crack across road, 28th August
item.description:
Pothole has been present for some months, but now pieces have broken further enlarging pothole. I have damaged my alloys in it. The whole road is in need of repair as previous attempts are just breaking up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Onslow Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crashed vehicle, 28th August
item.description:
This vehicle has now been here for weeks. The council's laziness and incompetence is mind blowing. Apart from being a visual blight, it's a danger to pedestrians and is a magnet for graffiti and rubbish. The council's utter failure to recover the vehicle is sadly emblematic of their neglect and disinterest.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61-63, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: LARGE POTHOLE O/S No 68 &No 70, 28th August
item.description:
Resident rep[orting there is a large pothole o/s the above properties on the road it is a No 51 Bus Route and heavy traffic along theis road which cause the house to shudder & shake, resident has recently come out ofd hospital having undergone surgery and her bedroom radiator shakes due to the heavy traffic going over the pothole, previously Engineers have come and just tarmacked the pothole over but the wear and tear it doesn't last long due to the metal plates that have cracked underneath. Please could someone look into this as a matter of urgency there may be similar or other reports but please action this due to the resident's surgery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Wellington Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bed, 28th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping at Zetland Apartments, 28th August
item.description:
I raised report number 8082655 which has been marked as fixed today but the rubbish is still there. Attaching photos from today. Fly-tipping at Zetland Apartments, 30 Stean Street, E8 4ED. Rubbish and unwanted items were left outside the property.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stean Street, Hackney, London

item.title: A Dead Bird in My Balcony, 28th August
item.description:
I woke up this morning and found a dead bird in my unused Balcony. I was on holiday and when I returned, I did not have any use of my Balcony but my workman pointed it out to me. I am scared because of Bird Flu. Can someone please come and remove it immedi
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Craven Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 28th August
item.description:
A double bed base has been left standing on the pavement at this location. I saw a man take it from his car and leave it there yesterday (Wednesday 27th August) but wasn't able to see his car registration.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Gate broken, 28th August
item.description:
The traffic gate is broken and left open. This undermines the traffic rules of the area, as cars and vans now use the estate as a cut through, breaking speed limits as they drive through. This has been repeatedly reported with no action. It is dangerous.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
